BE11:13am

This is Jerry Dellis at Jefferies, saying Dunstone's efforts to turn around TalkTalk are working about as well as everyone else's efforts to turn around TalkTalk.

BE11:14am

New ‘Fixed Low Price Plan’ is not delivering churn reduction as hoped. The monthly churn rate among TalkTalk’s retail on-net base declined by only -0.06pp y/y at Sep 2017 (to 1.37%). This was despite 1.62m customers (an estimated 54% of retail on-net base) having locked themselves into FLPP contracts into the last year. As FLPP contracts expire, the number of customers able to churn without penalty will increase rapidly: from 1.0m in Mar 2018e to 1.9m by Mar 2019e on our estimates.

Gladys The irony is that I got back from Iceland on Saturday night and there is a lot more snow here than in Reykjavik.
BE11:14am

We lower our Headline EBITDA forecasts by -4.5% in FY17/18 and by 11%-12% for the next two years. At the interim results, TalkTalk reframed its ‘Headline’ reporting perimeter to carve out loss-making MVNO operations. On a LFL basis, we estimate that our forecasts imply a -22% y/y decline in Headline EBITDA for FY17/18, with a further -5% y/y decline FY18/19 and +7% y/y growth in FY19/20. Our Headline EBITDA forecasts stand 3% below Bloomberg consensus (and 4% below latest guidance) for FY17/18 and 10%-15% below consensus for the next two years.

11:15 am
BE11:15am

So, we're back to frettinh about the divi. I mean, what little divi there is left.

h1 Is this new....https://broadbanddeals.co.uk/news/talktalk-value-add-161000-fibre-broadband-h1/
BE11:15am

The prospectus that accompanied TalkTalk’s Jan 2017 issue of £400m Senior Notes explains that cash dividends are permitted if one of three conditions is met. On our forecasts, the company will breach dividend covenants from FY19/20 if the current 7.5p DPS is sustained. (It would also run extremely close to a breach in FY18/19.) We model a 40% DPS cut (to 4.5p), taking effect in FY18/19. This is essentially the minimum cut that fulfils covenants.

BE11:28am

ISAT is facing higher costs associated with building out its inflight
connectivity business (now 1300 planes contracted), limited recovery in maritime and legacy declines. We expect near-term momentum to be impacted by the ongoing debate around the dividend (which has broadly been uncovered by FCF since 2011) and see limited scope for positive earnings momentum until late 2018. We downgrade to Neutral from Buy. Since being added to the Buy List on August 9, 2016, Inmarsat is -c.43% vs. FTSE World Europe +c.15%, driven by earnings downgrades as aero costs increased and revenue headwinds persisted.

red @FATDAZneed a perfect internet signal. watching anything live is v annoying if signal iffy. which it often it during game but never at half time
BE11:29am

ISAT continues to incur higher costs as it is accelerating the capture of inflight connectivity deals (Europe and Global deals). We continue to view the stock as a longer-term growth story given its exposure to growing segments in the satellite industry (aero, government and maritime). However, with capex remaining elevated through to 2020E as ISAT refreshes its satellite fleet, we expect limited FCF generation to continue to leave the dividend uncovered. We lower our price target to reflect higher costs and note continued uncertainty across the satellite space. We expect increasing supply of satellite capacity to remain a key investor concern at least until ISAT is able to show evidence of its aero capabilities as the service comes online (late 2018), with associated revenues/profitability.

BE11:30am

Our 12m price target falls to 580p (from 860p) driven by lower
estimates, as we cut our medium-term revenue/EBITDA estimates by 3% and 8% (c.30% cut in EPS). We also move to a DCF-based valuation for the core business (7.5% WACC, 1.5% TG), within our SOTP valuation including Ligado. We estimate ISAT currently trades on 17.8x 2019E EV/NoPAT vs. 20.1x at our price target.

This is the 7th new jurisdiction after UK, Australia, Cyprus, New Zealand, Isreal and South Africa. This should enable the company to continue to expand its customer base globally and diversify its geographical revenues. Plus500 currently trades on a CY17 P/E of 8.3x increasing to 9.1x since we conservatively expect reduced new customer acquistion and higher customer acquisition costs in future years on account of regulatory uncertainty. The CY17 dividend yield is 7.2% falling to 6.2%.

BE11:50am

The stand-alone, two-storey brick building is at the heart of the Fulton Market District, one of the oldest meatpacking and food distribution centres in the city going back to the 19th century. Today, this is one of Chicago’s thriving neighbourhoods attracting high footfall with its restaurants, bars, shops, galleries and hotels as well as offices occupied by some of the world’s leading companies. The Chicago location is expected to have a footprint of circa 50,000 sq ft, Accommodating almost 600 seats. There will be 16 food offerings, three bars as well as one demonstration kitchen and one retail area. Time Out Market will provide tenants with the facilities, equipment and support services in exchange for a share of revenue (Management typically target 30%), while bars will be directly managed by the Time Out Market team.

fjp73 I see the fall out of Steinhoff is hitting funds all over Asia and London today. When do these big funds do research properly?

11:51 am
BE11:51am

The first Time Out Market opened in 2014 in Lisbon and with 3.1 million visitors in 2016, reported strong year-on-year revenue growth of 115%. Following this proof of format, the Group is on track to roll out Time Out Market globally. With new Time Out Markets set to open in Miami in 2018 and in Boston in 2019, Chicago will mark the third location in the US. The Group is also working through planning in Porto (Portugal) and London. This all forms part of a global strategy to roll-out branded Time Out Markets which can deliver substantial hospitality based profits and provide a major crosssell opportunity with the Group’s eCommerce platform. Importantly, as part of the funding plan for the global Time Out Market roll out, the Group has secured a 5-year term loan with a gross commitment of €9m. This highlights the confidence in lenders in the execution of the roll-out and the future cash flows

red @VV75 client does his own damage. they could have a one buck spread and most folks will still lose. normal people arent built to be successful traders.

BE11:51am

Our FY17 forecasts remain unchanged (we expect a trading update end January). In FY18 we forecast substantial revenue growth reflecting the opening of new Markets and the success of the SEO driven organic approach to growing e-commerce revenues. The new debt facility highlights the potential opportunity to drive this growth and a move towards profitability without the necessity of further equity finance. Delivering the strategy and forecasts will reward investors with a high-value media asset. Our short-term target price of 195p remains unchanged and is based on a combination of sum-of-the-parts, DCF and FCF analysis.
